verses.verse: Now the serpent <WH5175> was more subtle <WH6175> than any <WH3605> beast <WH2416> of the field <WH7704> which <WH834> the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> had made. <WH6213> And he said <WH559> to the woman, <WH802> Yes, <WH637> <WH3588> has God <WH430> said, <WH559> You shall not eat <WH398> of every <WH3605> tree <WH6086> of the garden? <WH1588>
And the woman <WH802> said <WH559> to the serpent, <WH5175> We may eat <WH398> of the fruit <WH6529> of the trees <WH6086> of the garden: <WH1588>

But of the fruit <WH6529> of the tree <WH6086> which <WH834> is in the middle <WH8432> of the garden, <WH1588> God <WH430> has said, <WH559> You shall not eat <WH398> of it, neither <WH3808> shall you touch <WH5060> it, lest <WH6435> you die. <WH4191>
And the serpent <WH5175> said <WH559> to the woman, <WH802> You shall not surely die: <WH4191>

For God <WH430> does know <WH3045> that in the day <WH3117> you eat <WH398> thereof, then your eyes <WH5869> shall be opened, <WH6491> and you shall be as gods, <WH430> knowing <WH3045> good <WH2896> and evil. <WH7451>

And when the woman <WH802> saw <WH7200> that the tree <WH6086> was good <WH2896> for food, <WH3978> and that it was pleasant <WH8378> to the eyes, <WH5869> and a tree <WH6086> to be desired <WH2530> to make one wise, <WH7919> she took <WH3947> of the fruit <WH6529> thereof, and did eat, <WH398> and gave <WH5414> also <WH1571> to her husband <WH376> with her; and he did eat. <WH398>

And the eyes <WH5869> of them both <WH8147> were opened, <WH6491> and they knew <WH3045> that they were naked; <WH5903> and they sewed <WH8609> fig <WH8384> leaves <WH5929> together, and made <WH6213> themselves <WH1992> aprons. <WH2290>

And they heard <WH8085> the voice <WH6963> of the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> walking <WH1980> in the garden <WH1588> in the cool <WH7307> of the day: <WH3117> and Adam <WH120> and his wife <WH802> hid <WH2244> themselves from the presence <WH6440> of the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> among <WH8432> the trees <WH6086> of the garden. <WH1588>
And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> called <WH7121> to Adam, <WH120> and said <WH559> to him, Where <WH335> are you?
And he said, <WH559> I heard <WH8085> your voice <WH6963> in the garden, <WH1588> and I was afraid, <WH3372> because <WH3588> I was naked; <WH5903> and I hid <WH2244> myself.

And he said, <WH559> Who <WH4310> told <WH5046> you that you were naked? <WH5903> Have you eaten <WH398> of the tree, <WH6086> whereof <WH834> I commanded <WH6680> you that you should not eat? <WH398>
And the man <WH120> said, <WH559> The woman <WH802> whom <WH834> you gave <WH5414> to be with me, she gave <WH5414> me of the tree, <WH6086> and I did eat. <WH398>

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> to the woman, <WH802> What <WH4100> is this <WH2063> that you have done? <WH6213> And the woman <WH802> said, <WH559> The serpent <WH5175> beguiled <WH5377> me, and I did eat. <WH398>

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> said <WH559> to the serpent, <WH5175> Because <WH3588> you have done <WH6213> this, <WH2063> you are cursed <WH779> above all <WH3605> cattle, <WH929> and above every <WH3605> beast <WH2416> of the field; <WH7704> on your belly <WH1512> shall you go, <WH3212> and dust <WH6083> shall you eat <WH398> all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of your life: <WH2416>

And I will put <WH7896> enmity <WH342> between <WH996> you and the woman, <WH802> and between <WH996> your seed <WH2233> and her seed; <WH2233> it shall bruise <WH7779> your head, <WH7218> and you shall bruise <WH7779> his heel. <WH6119>

To the woman <WH802> he said, <WH559> I will greatly multiply <WH7235> your sorrow <WH6093> and your conception; <WH2032> in sorrow <WH6089> you shall bring <WH3205> forth <WH3205> children; <WH1121> and your desire <WH8669> shall be to your husband, <WH376> and he shall rule <WH4910> over you.

And to Adam <WH121> he said, <WH559> Because <WH3588> you have listened <WH8085> to the voice <WH6963> of your wife, <WH802> and have eaten <WH398> of the tree, <WH6086> of which <WH834> I commanded <WH6680> you, saying, <WH559> You shall not eat <WH398> of it: cursed <WH779> is the ground <WH127> for your sake; <WH5668> in sorrow <WH6093> shall you eat <WH398> of it all <WH3605> the days <WH3117> of your life; <WH2416>
Thorns <WH6975> also and thistles <WH1863> shall it bring <WH6779> forth <WH6779> to you; and you shall eat <WH398> the herb <WH6212> of the field; <WH7704>

In the sweat <WH2188> of your face <WH639> shall you eat <WH398> bread, <WH3899> till <WH5704> you return <WH7725> to the ground; <WH127> for out of it were you taken: <WH3947> for dust <WH6083> you are, and to dust <WH6083> shall you return. <WH7725>
And Adam <WH120> called <WH7121> his wife's <WH802> name <WH8034> Eve; <WH2332> because <WH3588> she was the mother <WH517> of all <WH3605> living. <WH2416>
To Adam <WH120> also and to his wife <WH802> did the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> make <WH6213> coats <WH3801> of skins, <WH5785> and clothed <WH3847> them.

And the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> said, <WH559> Behold, <WH2005> the man <WH120> is become <WH1961> as one <WH259> of us, to know <WH3045> good <WH2896> and evil: <WH7451> and now, <WH6258> lest <WH6435> he put <WH7971> forth <WH7971> his hand, <WH3027> and take <WH3947> also <WH1571> of the tree <WH6086> of life, <WH2416> and eat, <WH398> and live <WH2425> for ever: <WH5769>
Therefore the LORD <WH3068> God <WH430> sent <WH7971> him forth from the garden <WH1588> of Eden, <WH5731> to till <WH5647> the ground <WH127> from from where <WH834> <WH8033> he was taken. <WH3947>

So he drove <WH1644> out the man; <WH120> and he placed <WH7931> at the east <WH6924> of the garden <WH1588> of Eden <WH5731> Cherubim, <WH3742> and a flaming <WH3858> sword <WH2719> which turned <WH2015> every way, to keep <WH8104> the way of the tree <WH6086> of life. <WH2416>
